main event: A round, white object, larger than a star, was observed slowly descending and then fading to a reddish or orange glow before becoming invisible.
interesting points: The object was observed to change in color from bright white to reddish or orange, which was possibly due to some kind of explosive material or fuel.
The object appeared to burn out as it descended.
No azimuth or elevation information was provided, making it difficult to determine the probable track of the object.
The object was possibly an astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: A round, white object larger than a star
